intro: Decaspermum nitidum, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in some areas. Its botanical features make it both ecologically significant and a potential weed in agricultural settings.
